armor.name: Padded Armor
armor.description: This is the simplest type of armor, fashioned from quilted layers of cloth and batting. It tends to get hot and after a time becomes foul with sweat, grime, lice, and fleas.

armor.name: Leather Armor
armor.description: This armor is made of leather hardened in boiling oil and then shaped into breastplate and shoulder protectors. The remainder of the suit is fashioned from more flexible, somewhat softer materials.

armor.name: Studded Leather
armor.description: This armor is made from leather (not hardened as with normal leather armor) reinforced with close-set metal rivets. In some ways it is very similar to brigandine, although the spacing between each metal piece is greater.

armor.name: Ring Mail
armor.description: This armor is an early (and less effective) form of chain mail in which metal rings are sewn directly to a leather backing instead of being interlaced.

armor.name: Scale Mail
armor.description: This is a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish.

armor.name: Brigandine Armor
armor.description: This armor is made from small metal plates sewn or riveted to a layer of canvas or leather and protected by an outer layer of cloth. It is rather stiff and does not provide adequate protection to the joints where the metal plates must be spaced widely or left off.

armor.name: Hide Armor
armor.description: This is armor prepared from the extremely thick hide of a creature (such as an elephant) or from multiple layers of regular leather. It is stiff and hard to move in.

armor.name: Chain Mail
armor.description: This armor is made of interlocking metal rings. It is always worn with a layer of quilted fabric padding underneath to prevent painful chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. Several layers of mail are normally hung over vital areas.

armor.name: Bronze Plate Mail
armor.description: This is a plate mail armor—a combination of metal plates, chain mail or brigandine, leather and padding—made of softer bronze. It is easier and cheaper to make than steel armor, but it does not protect as well.

armor.name: Banded Mail
armor.description: This armor is made of overlapping strips of metal sewn to a backing of leather and chain mail. Generally the strips cover only the more vulnerable areas, while the chain and leather protect the joints where freedom of movement must be ensured.

armor.name: Splint Mail
armor.description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips riveted to a backing of leather and cloth padding. Since this is not flexible, the joints are protected by chain mail.

armor.name: Plate Mail
armor.description: This armor is a combination of chain or brigandine with metal plates (cuirass, epaulettes, elbow guards, gauntlets, tasets, and greaves) covering vital areas. The weight is distributed over the whole body and the whole thing is held together by buckles and straps. This is the most common form of heavy armor.

armor.name: Field Plate
armor.description: This is the most common version of full plate armor, consisting of shaped and fitted metal plates riveted and interlocked to cover the entire body. It includes gauntlets, boots, and a visored helmet. A thick layer of padding must be worn underneath. Each suit must be individually fitted to its owner.

armor.name: Full Plate
armor.description: This is the impressive, high Gothic-style armor of the Late Middle Ages and Renaissance. All plates are interlocking and carefully angled to deflect blows. Surfaces are usually highly ornamented. Each suit is custom-fitted, making it extremely expensive and more ceremonial than practical.

weapons.name: Battle axe
weapons.description: A heavy-bladed axe used in one hand or two. Common among dwarves and northern warriors. Delivers powerful chopping attacks.

weapons.name: Blowgun
weapons.description: A stealthy, low-damage weapon favored by tribal hunters and assassins. Fires small darts over short distances.

weapons.name: Barbed Dart
weapons.description: A small throwing weapon with barbed tips to cause painful wounds. Often used in quantity to overcome defenses.

weapons.name: Needle
weapons.description: Tiny projectile, sometimes coated in poison. Ineffective alone, but deadly in specific applications.

weapons.name: Composite long bow
weapons.description: A reinforced long bow that grants greater range and can take advantage of high Strength for bonus damage if specially crafted.

weapons.name: Composite short bow
weapons.description: A shorter version of the composite long bow, usable in tighter spaces. Can also apply Strength bonuses if built for it.

weapons.name: Flight arrow
weapons.description: A lightweight arrow designed for long range rather than maximum damage. Commonly used in hunting.

weapons.name: Long bow
weapons.description: Tall bow designed for long-range combat. Effective in war and hunting, often wielded by elves and archers.

weapons.name: Sheaf arrow
weapons.description: Heavier arrow with a broad head, designed for armor penetration. Less range than flight arrows.

weapons.name: Short bow
weapons.description: A compact bow with limited range. Usable by smaller characters or in cramped environments.

weapons.name: Hand quarrel
weapons.description: Short bolt used in hand crossbows. Lighter and less damaging than larger quarrels.

weapons.name: Hand crossbow
weapons.description: A compact crossbow easily wielded in one hand. Fires small bolts quickly but with lower power.

weapons.name: Heavy quarrel
weapons.description: Large bolts used in heavy crossbows. Delivers devastating force, especially at close range.

weapons.name: Heavy crossbow
weapons.description: A powerful ranged weapon requiring a crank to reload. Extremely lethal, but slow to fire.

weapons.name: Light quarrel
weapons.description: Medium-sized bolt suited for light crossbows, balancing damage and reload time.

weapons.name: Light crossbow
weapons.description: More agile than the heavy version, this crossbow is common among guards and hunters.

weapons.name: Dagger or dirk
weapons.description: Can be thrown at close range. Used when a quick backup ranged option is needed.

weapons.name: Footman's flail
weapons.description: A military version of the flail with a spiked head attached to a handle by a sturdy chain. Effective against armored opponents due to its crushing power.

weapons.name: Footman's mace
weapons.description: A spiked or flanged metal club designed to inflict maximum damage to heavily armored foes. Reliable and simple.

weapons.name: Footman's pick
weapons.description: A hammer-like weapon with a sharp metal spike, ideal for puncturing plate armor. Requires strength to wield effectively.

weapons.name: Hand or throwing axe
weapons.description: A compact axe usable in close combat or thrown. Useful as a backup weapon for warriors and woodsmen alike.

weapons.name: Harpoon
weapons.description: A large barbed spear used in hunting sea creatures or large game. Effective in melee and can be thrown.

weapons.name: Horseman's flail
weapons.description: A one-handed version of the military flail, ideal for mounted combat. Delivers powerful blows from horseback.

weapons.name: Horseman's mace
weapons.description: A compact version of the footman’s mace, optimized for mounted use. Offers crushing power while remaining maneuverable.

weapons.name: Horseman's pick
weapons.description: A short pick with a powerful spike. Designed to pierce armor, particularly useful while mounted.

weapons.name: Javelin
weapons.description: A throwing spear, balancing range and power. Usable in both melee and ranged combat.

weapons.name: Heavy horse lance
weapons.description: A long and heavy spear used from horseback. Requires a heavy warhorse and does massive damage on the charge.

weapons.name: Light horse lance
weapons.description: A shorter and lighter lance, suitable for swift charges by mounted troops on light warhorses.

weapons.name: Jousting lance
weapons.description: A heavy horse lance with a blunted tip designed for tournaments. Used to unseat opponents rather than injure them.

weapons.name: Medium horse lance
weapons.description: A balanced lance designed for medium warhorses, providing a good mix of speed and power in mounted combat.

weapons.name: Morning star
weapons.description: A spiked club combining aspects of a mace and a flail. Highly effective against armored foes due to its crushing and piercing abilities.

weapons.name: Bardiche
weapons.description: A large, curving axe-head mounted on a long pole, derived from peasant tools. Requires space to swing effectively and delivers powerful slashes.

weapons.name: Bec de corbin
weapons.description: A specialized weapon of the upper classes during the Late Middle Ages, the bec de corbin features a powerful pick designed to pierce plate armor, a hammer face for crushing, and a blade for slashing unarmored foes. Requires space to swing effectively.

weapons.name: Bill-guisarme
weapons.description: A complex polearm combining a cleaver blade, a back spike, and a hook. Designed for multiple uses and mounted on a long shaft. Requires significant space to wield.

weapons.name: Fauchard
weapons.description: A polearm with a long, inward-curving blade. Derived from agricultural tools, it's capable of slashing or limited thrusting. Simple for peasants to repurpose from a scythe.

weapons.name: Fauchard-fork
weapons.description: A modified fauchard featuring a spike or fork on the reverse to improve thrusting ability. Still not particularly efficient in battle.

weapons.name: Guisarme
weapons.description: Originating from a pruning hook, the guisarme is a heavy, curved blade on a pole. Although convenient, it is not especially effective in combat.

weapons.name: Guisarme-voulge
weapons.description: This weapon has a modified axe blade mounted on an eight-foot-long shaft. The blade tapers to a point for thrusting, and a back spike or hook is fitted for punching through armor or dismounting riders【83:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Halberd
weapons.description: A popular polearm featuring a large axe blade, a spear point, and a back hook for grappling armor or pulling riders from horses. Designed for flexibility in combat, especially in close melee against pikes【83:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Hook fauchard
weapons.description: An enhancement of the fauchard with a hook added to the back of the blade, supposedly for unseating mounted foes. Like the fauchard, it's not very effective【83:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Voulge
weapons.description: A long polearm topped with a cleaver-like blade. Easy to manufacture and learn, this weapon is also known as the Lochaber axe【83:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Scourge
weapons.description: A vicious short whip with multiple tails, each barbed with metal. Used in both punishment and brutal melee fighting【83:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Sickle
weapons.description: A small hand-held farming tool with a curved blade. Adapted for combat, it slashes effectively at close range, though it offers little reach.

weapons.name: Sling
weapons.description: A primitive but effective ranged weapon. Fires bullets or stones with surprising force.

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.description: Thrown or used in melee, the spear is versatile. Common among tribal warriors and soldiers.

weapons.name: Staff sling
weapons.description: A sling mounted on a staff, offering greater leverage and range at the cost of reload time.

weapons.name: One-handed
weapons.description: A general-purpose melee weapon, typically a short or long sword, usable in one hand for balanced offense and defense.

weapons.name: Two-handed
weapons.description: A large sword that must be wielded with both hands. Offers great power and reach at the cost of speed and shield use.

weapons.name: Broad sword
weapons.description: A wide-bladed sword used primarily for slashing. Balanced for one-handed combat, it is a popular choice among seasoned warriors.

weapons.name: Khopesh
weapons.description: An ancient Egyptian blade with a sickle-like curve near the tip. Difficult to wield, but its shape allows it to hook weapons and limbs【89:5†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

weapons.name: Long sword
weapons.description: A classic slashing weapon and knight’s favorite. Balanced and effective against most foes. Usable one-handed or two-handed.

weapons.name: Scimitar
weapons.description: A curved blade of Middle Eastern origin, optimized for slashing attacks. Popular among desert and cavalry warriors.

weapons.name: Short sword
weapons.description: A light thrusting weapon ideal for close quarters or stealth. Commonly used by rogues and lightly armored fighters.

weapons.name: Two-hand. sword
weapons.description: A massive, double-handed blade. Delivers devastating slashes but is slow and unwieldy. Effective against groups or large creatures.

weapons.name: Trident
weapons.description: Three-pronged spear used for fishing or combat. Can be thrown with moderate effectiveness.

weapons.name: Warhammer
weapons.description: A one-handed hammer with a heavy head designed for crushing armor. Favored by dwarves and clerics alike.

items.name: Backpack
items.description: A sturdy sack worn on the back with shoulder straps. It can hold up to 50 lbs. of gear and is a staple of any adventurer's equipment.

items.name: Flint and Steel
items.description: A basic fire-starting kit used to ignite tinder, torches, or campfires. Essential for survival in the wild.

items.name: Grappling Hook
items.description: A metal hook tied to a rope, useful for climbing or snagging items from a distance.

items.name: Hammer (small)
items.description: A small tool used for driving spikes or nails. Often carried with pitons for climbing.

items.name: Holy Symbol, Iron
items.description: A small icon representing a deity. Used by priests to channel divine power. Iron versions are sturdy and inexpensive.

items.name: Holy Water (vial)
items.description: A vial of sanctified water harmful to undead. Must be thrown to shatter and release its effect.

items.name: Mirror (small, steel)
items.description: A polished steel mirror useful for checking corners, signaling, or avoiding gaze attacks like those of a medusa.

items.name: Rations, iron (1 week)
items.description: Dried and preserved food suitable for travel. More durable than fresh rations, though heavier and less pleasant.

items.name: Signal Whistle
items.description: A small whistle used to alert allies or send coded signals. Especially helpful in low-visibility conditions.

items.name: Torch
items.description: A wooden stick wrapped in cloth and soaked in pitch. Burns for 30 minutes and provides illumination in dark areas.

items.name: Waterskin
items.description: A leather container for carrying water or other fluids. Holds about one quart and keeps contents relatively cool.

items.name: Whetstone
items.description: A flat stone used to sharpen blades. Maintains the effectiveness of cutting and piercing weapons.

items.name: Belt
items.description: A protective or decorative band worn around the waist. In some armor types like gladiator gear, metal belts also offer minor protection【109:4†TSR 2110 - PHBR1 - The Complete Fighter's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Boots, Riding
items.description: Sturdy, high-topped boots designed to protect the legs while mounted. Provide ankle support and shield from saddle wear.

items.name: Boots, Soft
items.description: Lightweight boots made from supple leather or cloth. Comfortable and quiet, preferred by thieves or indoor dwellers.

items.name: Breeches
items.description: Trousers that extend to the knee or slightly below. Common among travelers and those requiring leg mobility.

items.name: Cap, hat
items.description: A padded, leather, or steel skullcap, worn like a close-fitting beret or hat. Provides no penalty to vision and only a -1 penalty to hearing checks due to partial ear coverage. Commonly used with light armor types.

items.name: Cloak, Good cloth
items.description: A finely woven woolen or linen cloak, offering moderate protection against wind and rain. Common for everyday wear.

items.name: Cloak, Fine fur
items.description: A cloak made from luxurious animal pelts, offering exceptional warmth and a sign of wealth or nobility.

items.name: Girdle
items.description: A thick belt worn at the waist, often for support or ornament. In some cases, it may serve a symbolic or ceremonial role.

items.name: Gloves
items.description: Worn on the hands to protect from cold or abrasion. Often made from leather or wool and tailored for comfort.

items.name: Gown, common
items.description: A simple, long dress typically worn by women or scholars. Made from coarse fabric and meant for daily use.

items.name: Hose
items.description: Close-fitting leg coverings, commonly worn beneath tunics or breeches. Often knitted or sewn from linen or wool.

items.name: Knife sheath
items.description: A leather or cloth sheath designed to hold a utility or eating knife. Worn at the belt for convenience and safety.

items.name: Mittens
items.description: Wool or fur hand coverings with a single compartment for the fingers and one for the thumb. Provide warmth in cold weather, commonly used by laborers or travelers.

items.name: Pin
items.description: A straight metal fastener used to secure cloaks, veils, or tunics. Often simple in form but sometimes engraved or tipped with decorative metalwork.

items.name: Plain brooch
items.description: A small, unadorned brooch made of brass, bronze, or iron. Used to fasten cloaks or robes, it is a common accessory among the lower and middle classes.

items.name: Robe, Common
items.description: A long, loose garment made of coarse linen or wool. Worn by scholars, monks, or commoners. Provides minimal warmth but full coverage.

items.name: Robe, Embroidered
items.description: A finely made robe, decorated with threadwork along hems and sleeves. Worn by mages, priests, or the well-off, it serves both fashion and status.

items.name: Sandals
items.description: Open footwear with straps, offering basic protection while allowing breathability. Common in warm climates.

items.name: Sash
items.description: A long strip of cloth or silk tied around the waist or shoulder. Used to cinch garments or add ornamental flair.

items.name: Shoes
items.description: Standard low-cut footwear made of leather or cloth, suited for indoor or everyday use.

items.name: Silk jacket
items.description: A close-fitting, luxurious upper garment made of dyed silk, typically worn by nobles or high-ranking merchants. May be padded or quilted for warmth.

items.name: Surcoat
items.description: A cloth garment worn over armor or robes, often bearing a heraldic symbol. Designed to identify the wearer and protect armor from the elements.

items.name: Sword scabbard, hanger, baldric
items.description: A leather scabbard attached to a belt or shoulder strap (baldric) to carry a sword. Includes fittings for comfortable wear and easy draw.

items.name: Tabard
items.description: A sleeveless overgarment worn over armor or tunic, usually bearing a crest or colors. Common among soldiers, knights, and heralds.

items.name: Toga, coarse
items.description: A draped, single-piece garment of heavy wool. Crude in appearance and likely worn for ceremonial or religious purposes in archaic or traditional cultures.

items.name: Tunic
items.description: A long shirt or short robe, worn as a base layer or casual clothing. Often belted at the waist.

items.name: Vest
items.description: A sleeveless garment worn over a tunic or shirt. May serve as a light outer layer or an underlayer for formality or warmth.

items.name: Ale (per gallon)
items.description: A gallon of fermented grain beverage. Stronger than small beer, and a staple in inns and taverns【141:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Banquet (per person)
items.description: A lavish meal with multiple courses, suitable for celebrations or impressing guests【141:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Bread
items.description: A loaf of baked grain dough, a basic staple food in nearly all settlements【141:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cheese
items.description: A preserved dairy product made from curdled milk, offering flavor and sustenance【141:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: City rooms (per month), Common
items.description: A modest but comfortable room in a city, rented monthly, typically including a bed and shared access to facilities【141:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: City rooms (per month), Poor
items.description: Basic shelter in a crowded room or attic, offering little privacy or comfort【141:8†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Common wine (pitcher)
items.description: A pitcher of locally produced wine, generally weak and cheap. Served in inns and taverns【141:8†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Egg or fresh vegetables
items.description: A single egg or a small portion of seasonal vegetables. Sold individually in markets【141:8†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Grain and stabling for horse (daily)
items.description: Includes feed and a stall for a horse for one night. Offered at inns or city stables【141:8†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Honey
items.description: A small clay pot of sweet, natural honey. Used as food, medicine, or sweetener【141:8†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Inn lodging (per day), Common
items.description: A simple room at a roadside inn. Includes a shared chamber with straw bedding and basic amenities.

items.name: Inn lodging (per week), Common
items.description: A week's stay in a modest inn. Shared or semi-private room with limited comfort, often used by merchants.

items.name: Inn lodging (per day), Poor
items.description: Floor space in a communal room or barn, often with little more than a blanket and a roof.

items.name: Inn lodging (per week), Poor
items.description: A week’s worth of poor accommodation, offering minimal shelter and little privacy.

items.name: Meat for one meal
items.description: A portion of cooked or preserved meat, such as mutton, beef, or poultry. Often part of a main course【153:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Meals (per day), Good
items.description: Includes multiple courses of well-prepared food, often with meat and dessert. Suitable for merchants or nobles on the road【153:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Meals (per day), Common
items.description: A reasonable variety of filling food, including stews, bread, and ale. Adequate for average laborers or adventurers【153:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Meals (per day), Poor
items.description: A day's worth of meager food—usually porridge, thin soup, and hard bread. Just enough to stave off hunger【153:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Separate latrine for rooms (per month)
items.description: Rental of a private latrine facility, separate from shared accommodations. Often leased by wealthier residents or businesses.

items.name: Small beer (per gallon)
items.description: A weakly fermented beverage made from grain, often consumed in place of water. Low in alcohol, cheap, and safe to drink in most towns and inns.

items.name: Soup
items.description: A bowl of hot broth containing vegetables, grains, and occasionally meat. Simple, nourishing fare【159:16†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Barrel of pickled fish
items.description: A large cask of preserved fish, pickled in brine. Common among sailors and remote communities where fresh meat is rare【176:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Butter (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of churned butter made from cream. Used in cooking or as a spread for bread【176:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Coarse sugar (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of raw, minimally refined sugar crystals. Used in baking and sweetening food【176:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Dry rations (per week)
items.description: A week’s supply of preserved travel food—hardtack, jerky, dried fruit. Durable but bland【176:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Eggs (per 100)
items.description: A large crate of 100 eggs, typically chicken. Suitable for long-term provisioning or trade【176:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Eggs (per two dozen)
items.description: Two dozen fresh eggs, typically chicken. Common staple sold by weight or count in most markets【182:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Figs (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of dried or fresh figs. Nutritious and sweet, popular in temperate regions【182:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Firewood (per day)
items.description: A bundle of firewood sufficient for cooking and heating for one day. Essential for travelers or rural households【182:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Herbs (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of culinary or medicinal herbs, dried or fresh. Used in cooking, potions, or healing【182:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Nuts (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of mixed or single-type nuts. Long-lasting, nutritious, and often expensive compared to other staples【182:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Raisins (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of dried grapes. Raisins are sweet, calorie-rich, and resistant to spoilage, making them ideal for travel【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Rice (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of dried rice grains. Common staple food, boiled or stewed as part of many meals. Easy to store and cook.

items.name: Salt (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of salt used to preserve food or enhance flavor. Vital for food storage and trade【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Salted herring (per 100)
items.description: A bulk quantity of preserved fish. Brined and salted for long-term storage, common among coastal traders【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Spice (per lb.), Exotic (e.g., saffron, clove)
items.description: Rare and luxurious spices. Strong in flavor and used sparingly, often imported from distant lands【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Spice (per lb.), Rare (e.g., pepper, ginger)
items.description: High-demand spices with strong culinary or medicinal uses. Costly but more available than exotic types【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Spice (per lb.), Uncommon (cinnamon)
items.description: Moderately available spices used in everyday cooking. Adds flavor and mild preservative effects【188:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Tun of cider (250 gal.)
items.description: A large wooden barrel filled with 250 gallons of fermented apple cider. Common in rural inns, taverns, or estate stores for feasting and trade.

items.name: Tun of good wine (250 gal.)
items.description: A massive wooden barrel filled with 250 gallons of well-aged wine. Stored in noble estates, merchant cellars, or temples for feasts and rituals.

items.name: Bath
items.description: A hot or cold wash in a public or private facility. Helps remove dirt and fatigue, and may include scented oils【234:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Clerk (per letter)
items.description: A literate individual who can transcribe or write formal documents, contracts, or letters on behalf of others【234:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Doctor, leech, or bleeding
items.description: A primitive form of medical aid involving bloodletting, herbal treatments, or leech application to balance humors【234:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Guide, in city (per day)
items.description: A local familiar with the city's layout, hired to escort or lead others to specific destinations【234:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Lantern or torchbearer (per night)
items.description: A hired hand who carries a light source to illuminate dark streets or dungeons. May serve as a minor valet or assistant【234:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Laundry (by load)
items.description: Clothes are washed by hand in a public washhouse or private facility. Cost is per full load of garments【240:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Messenger, in city (per message)
items.description: A runner or courier hired to carry a single message across town. Quick and affordable communication【240:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Minstrel (per performance)
items.description: A traveling musician, singer, or bard hired for entertainment. Often used at inns, parties, or ceremonies【240:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Mourner (per funeral)
items.description: A professional attendee who adds solemnity or symbolic presence at a funeral. Hired by families or temples【240:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Teamster w/wagon
items.description: A driver and wagon for hire, transporting goods or people overland. Cost is per mile of travel【240:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Barge
items.description: A flat-bottomed boat used for transporting goods or passengers on rivers and canals. Operated by poles, tow animals, or rudders.

items.name: Canoe, Small
items.description: A narrow, open boat propelled by paddles. Typically holds two people and suitable for calm rivers or lakes【368:4†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Canoe, War
items.description: A larger, sturdier canoe designed to carry additional warriors or cargo. Used for scouting or ambushes along waterways【368:4†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Caravel
items.description: A two- or three-masted sailing ship with square sails. Used in late medieval settings. 70 ft. long, carries 30–40 crew, with 150–200 tons cargo capacity【368:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Carriage, Common
items.description: A four-wheeled vehicle drawn by horses. Offers covered transport for passengers and modest cargo over land.

items.name: Carriage, Coach, ornamented
items.description: A richly decorated, four-wheeled enclosed carriage drawn by horses. Used by nobles and high-ranking officials for elegant travel.

items.name: Chariot, Riding
items.description: A lightweight two-wheeled vehicle for swift travel on roads. Often drawn by one or two horses, used in races or ceremonies.

items.name: Chariot, War
items.description: A heavier two-wheeled chariot designed for battle. Manned by a driver and a warrior, it is pulled by war-trained horses.

items.name: Coaster
items.description: A small, shallow-draft sailing vessel used for coastal trading. Carries cargo between ports with a minimal crew.

items.name: Cog
items.description: A sea-worthy sailing vessel with one or two square-rigged masts, capable of open sea travel. Crew: 18–20, cargo: 100–200 tons【374:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Curragh
items.description: A lightweight boat made with leather stretched over a wooden frame. Used by islanders and riverfolk for fishing or transport.

items.name: Drakkar
items.description: A long, narrow Viking ship with a single square sail and oars. Fast and agile, used for raids and exploration.

items.name: Dromond
items.description: A large Mediterranean war galley with multiple banks of oars. Designed for naval combat and troop transport.

items.name: Galleon
items.description: A heavily built sailing ship with high fore and aft castles. Equipped with multiple decks and used for oceanic trade or warfare.

items.name: Great galley
items.description: A late medieval coastal warship, 130 feet long and 20 feet wide. Powered by 140 rowers and three masts. Carries up to 150 tons of cargo or marines. Not seaworthy in heavy weather【380:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Knarr
items.description: A Norse merchant ship with broader hull and deeper draft than a drakkar. Used for transporting goods over long distances.

items.name: Longship
items.description: A versatile Viking vessel powered by oars and sail. Shallow draft allows river and coastal navigation. Used in war and travel.

items.name: Oar, Common
items.description: A standard rowing oar for small boats or canoes. Typically made of hardwood and used in pairs.

items.name: Oar, Galley
items.description: A long, reinforced oar used aboard large vessels like galleys. Requires strong rowers and teamwork.

items.name: Raft or small keelboat
items.description: A simple watercraft with limited steering. Suitable for rivers or calm waters. Often made of logs or planks.

items.name: Sail
items.description: Canvas rigging used to capture wind and propel sailing ships. Comes in various shapes depending on the ship class.

items.name: Sedan chair
items.description: A personal transport enclosed by panels or curtains, carried by two or four servants using shoulder poles. Common in urban aristocracy.

items.name: Wagon or cart wheel
items.description: A single replacement wheel for carts or wagons. Crafted from wood and banded in iron, essential for overland transport maintenance.

items.name: Boar
items.description: A wild pig known for its aggression and strength. Occasionally domesticated or trained as a mount by savage tribes【196:7†TSR 2110 - PHBR1 - The Complete Fighter's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Bull
items.description: A powerful male bovine, often used for breeding or as a symbol of strength. Not suited for riding but useful for farming and pulling loads【196:13†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Calf
items.description: A young bovine, typically kept for breeding or sale. Not useful for labor or riding due to its size and age【196:13†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Camel
items.description: A desert beast of burden able to carry heavy loads and endure harsh, arid conditions for long journeys【196:13†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Capon
items.description: A castrated rooster bred for meat. Tamer and fatter than regular chickens, used primarily for food【196:13†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cat
items.description: A common domestic feline, often kept for companionship or pest control. Quiet, independent, and agile【202:4†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Chicken
items.description: A domestic fowl raised for its eggs or meat. Easy to care for and widely available【202:4†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cow
items.description: A large female bovine, raised for milk production and occasionally meat. Valuable as a long-term agricultural asset【202:4†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Dog, Guard
items.description: Trained to protect property or people, these dogs are loyal and aggressive when defending their territory【202:4†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Dog, Hunting
items.description: Specially trained dogs used to locate and retrieve game. Intelligent and responsive to commands【202:4†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Dog, War
items.description: A large, trained canine bred for battle. Equipped with leather armor and capable of attacking on command.

items.name: Donkey, mule, or ass
items.description: Sure-footed pack animals used for carrying loads or pulling carts. Hardy and less expensive than horses【208:16†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Elephant, Labor
items.description: A massive beast used in royal construction projects and cargo hauling. Intelligent and capable of bearing great weight.

items.name: Elephant, War
items.description: A fearsome battlefield mount equipped with armor and howdah. Causes terror among infantry and cavalry alike.

items.name: Falcon (trained)
items.description: A trained bird of prey used by nobles and hunters for sport or scouting. Requires expert handling【208:16†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Goat
items.description: A hardy farm animal kept for milk, meat, and hide. Agile and adaptable to rough terrain【208:16†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Goose
items.description: A domestic waterfowl raised for meat, eggs, and as a natural alarm. Aggressive when startled.

items.name: Guinea hen
items.description: A spotted fowl known for insect control and loud calls. Prized in rural farms and estates.

items.name: Horse, Draft
items.description: A large, muscular horse bred to haul heavy loads. Not suited for speed or combat【208:16†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Horse, Heavy war
items.description: The most powerful warhorse, bred for strength and combat. Can carry full plate barding and a heavily armored rider. Ideal for knights and cavalry【214:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Horse, Light war
items.description: A swift and agile warhorse, used by scouts or light cavalry. Not suited for heavy armor but excellent for mobility and charges【214:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Horse, Medium war
items.description: A balance between power and speed. Common mount for professional soldiers. Can wear moderate barding and support a combat load【214:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Horse, Riding
items.description: A general-purpose horse used for travel and light transport. Not trained for battle and easily panicked by combat【214:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Hunting cat (jaguar, etc.)
items.description: A trained large feline used by nobles for hunting. Fierce, loyal, and dangerous when provoked.

items.name: Ox
items.description: A large draft animal used for pulling plows and carts. Strong and slow, ideal for agricultural work【220:11†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Partridge
items.description: A small game bird commonly raised or hunted for food. Often found in temperate forests and grasslands.

items.name: Peacock
items.description: A brightly feathered bird kept as a status symbol. Valued for beauty more than utility【220:11†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Pig
items.description: A common farm animal raised for meat. Hardy and omnivorous, it can thrive in many climates and diets【214:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Pigeon
items.description: A common bird used for food or as a messenger when trained. Easy to care for and widespread.

items.name: Pigeon, homing
items.description: A trained bird capable of delivering messages over long distances. Essential for military and clandestine communication.

items.name: Pony
items.description: A short, sturdy horse ideal for children, travel in rough terrain, or pulling small carts.

items.name: Ram
items.description: A mature male sheep known for aggressive ramming during mating season. Kept for breeding and fleece.

items.name: Sheep
items.description: A wool-bearing herd animal. Valued for fleece, milk, and meat.

items.name: Songbird
items.description: A caged bird prized for melodic singing. Kept for companionship and ambiance.

items.name: Swan
items.description: A graceful waterfowl known for its beauty. Often associated with nobility and gardens.

items.name: Barding, Chain
items.description: Interlocking metal rings fitted to protect a warhorse. Balances defense with mobility.

items.name: Barding, Full plate
items.description: Custom-fitted metal plates covering the horse entirely. Provides maximum protection but hinders speed.

items.name: Barding, Full scale
items.description: Metal scales sewn into leather to cover the horse fully. Heavier than chain but less rigid than plate.

items.name: Barding, Half brigandine
items.description: Metal plates riveted inside cloth or leather. Protects front and sides of the mount.

items.name: Barding, Half padded
items.description: Quilted cloth armor for partial coverage. Lightweight and inexpensive.

items.name: Barding, Half scale
items.description: Partial coverage of scaled armor, focused on neck and chest. Offers moderate protection.

items.name: Barding, Leather or padded
items.description: Basic armor made from hardened leather or thick cloth. Minimal protection, used for training or scouts.

items.name: Bit and bridle
items.description: Standard headgear for riding animals. Includes reins and a metal bit for control.

items.name: Cart harness
items.description: Leather straps and yokes used to attach animals to carts or wagons.

items.name: Halter
items.description: A simple head strap used for leading or tying an animal. No control bit included.

items.name: Horseshoes & shoeing
items.description: Iron horseshoes and fitting service. Protects hooves on rough terrain.

items.name: Saddle, Pack
items.description: A frame saddle for securing gear to a pack animal. Not suitable for riders.

items.name: Saddle, Riding
items.description: A padded saddle designed for horseback travel. Often includes stirrup attachments.

items.name: Saddle bags, Large
items.description: Two large leather bags hung across a saddle. Used for carrying equipment or goods.

items.name: Saddle bags, Small
items.description: Smaller version of saddle bags, ideal for tools, documents, or rations.

items.name: Saddle blanket
items.description: Thick cloth placed beneath the saddle to protect the horse’s back and absorb sweat.

items.name: Yoke, Horse
items.description: A wooden harness bar used to link horses in teams for plowing or transport.

items.name: Yoke, Ox
items.description: Heavier yoke tailored to the thick necks of oxen. Designed for slow, heavy hauling.

items.name: Barrel, small
items.description: A stout wooden container with reinforced hoops. Holds large quantities of liquid or dry goods. Useful for transport or storage【254:11†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Basket, Large
items.description: A woven container used to carry or store loose items. The large version can hold up to 20 lbs. of goods【254:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Basket, Small
items.description: A compact woven basket suitable for lighter or smaller objects. Weight capacity is up to 10 lbs.【254:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Bell
items.description: A small hand-held bell, often used to attract attention or signal others. Common among vendors, priests, or guards【254:11†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Belt pouch, Large
items.description: A leather pouch worn on the belt, used for carrying coins or small items. Large version holds up to 8 lbs.【254:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Belt pouch, Small
items.description: A smaller leather pouch, convenient for concealing valuables. Holds up to 5 lbs. of contents【254:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Block and tackle
items.description: A system of pulleys and rope used to lift or haul heavy objects with ease. Often used aboard ships or in construction【260:0†items.json】.

items.name: Bolt case
items.description: A leather or wooden container for carrying quarrels (crossbow bolts). Protects ammunition from damage and weather【260:0†items.json】.

items.name: Bucket
items.description: A sturdy wooden or metal container with a handle, used for carrying water, sand, or other loose materials【260:0†items.json】.

items.name: Chain (per ft.), Heavy
items.description: Heavy-duty chain links, ideal for restraining large beasts or securing heavy cargo. Sold by the foot【260:0†items.json】.

items.name: Chain (per ft.), Light
items.description: Lighter and more flexible than heavy chain. Often used for hanging objects, traps, or securing doors【260:0†items.json】.

items.name: Chest, Large
items.description: A heavy wooden container reinforced with iron. Used to store large quantities of goods or treasure. Can hold up to 100 lbs.【266:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Chest, Small
items.description: A sturdy wooden box with a hinged lid. Suitable for storing personal valuables. Can hold up to 40 lbs.【266:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cloth (per 10 sq. yds.), Common
items.description: Basic woven fabric used for clothing, blankets, or general trade. Inexpensive and widely available【266:5†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cloth (per 10 sq. yds.), Fine
items.description: High-quality textile suitable for upper-class garments, banners, or decorative work【266:5†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Cloth (per 10 sq. yds.), Rich
items.description: Luxurious material used for noble garments, banners, or fine furnishings. Dense weave with rich coloration and often embroidered【353:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Candle
items.description: A wax cylinder with a wick, used for illumination. Burns for about one hour【353:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Canvas (per sq. yard)
items.description: A coarse, durable fabric used in sails, tents, and coverings. Waterproof when treated【353:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Chalk
items.description: A short stick of white or colored calcium carbonate used for marking surfaces. Useful for navigation, tracking, or writing temporary messages【266:5†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Crampons
items.description: Spiked metal frames attached to boots, allowing travel over ice or hard-packed snow【353:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Fishhook
items.description: A small metal hook for catching fish, typically used with line and bait【353:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Fishing net, 10 ft. sq.
items.description: A woven mesh net measuring 10 feet square. Used for fishing or entangling small creatures. Can be weighted for underwater use.

items.name: Glass bottle
items.description: A fragile container made of clear glass, typically used to store potions, ink, or other fluids【278:1†items.json】.

items.name: Holy item (symbol, water, etc.)
items.description: A sacred item used by priests or devout followers—may include a holy symbol, blessed water, or relic tied to a faith.

items.name: Hourglass
items.description: A timekeeping device using sand to measure short durations. Often used for rituals, speeches, or laboratory work【359:4†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Iron pot
items.description: A cast iron cooking vessel with a handle. Suitable for preparing meals over a fire【284:11†items.json】.

items.name: Ladder, 10 ft.
items.description: A simple wooden ladder useful for reaching higher places. Can be tied to a pack or carried alongside【290:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Lantern, Beacon
items.description: A high-intensity lantern designed to serve as a stationary beacon or navigation signal. Burns brighter and longer than common lanterns.

items.name: Lantern, Bullseye
items.description: A directional lantern with polished reflectors and a shutter to focus light in a 60-foot beam. Burns one flask of oil for six hours【290:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Lantern, Hooded
items.description: A lantern with shutters on all sides, casting light in a 30-foot radius. Burns one flask of oil for six hours【290:2†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Lock, Good
items.description: A well-crafted mechanical lock with a heavy key. Offers significant resistance to tampering but can still be bypassed with great skill【296:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Lock, Poor
items.description: A simple lock with minimal security. Easily broken or picked by an experienced thief【296:0†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Magnifying glass
items.description: A small, curved lens that magnifies objects placed beneath it. Useful for inspecting tiny details or identifying objects.

items.name: Map or scroll case
items.description: A cylindrical case made of leather or wood for protecting scrolls, maps, or legal documents from the elements.

items.name: Merchant's scale
items.description: A set of balanced weights and scales used by merchants to measure goods for trade, taxes, or inventory.

items.name: Musical instrument
items.description: An instrument of the player's choice, such as a lute, flute, drum, or harp. Used for entertainment, bardic magic, or ritual purposes【302:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Oil (per flask)
items.description: A pint of lamp oil, used to fuel lanterns or start fires. Burns for six hours in a lantern【302:10†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Oil, Greek fire
items.description: A sealed flask of volatile oil that ignites on contact with flame. Used as a weapon or siege tool. Dangerous to store.

items.name: Oil, Lamp
items.description: A flask of refined oil intended for lantern use. Burns cleanly for long durations. Not suitable for throwing.

items.name: Paper (per sheet)
items.description: A single sheet of paper used for writing or printing. Expensive and fragile compared to parchment【302:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Papyrus (per sheet)
items.description: A thin sheet of pressed reeds used as a writing surface in dry climates. Less durable than parchment.

items.name: Parchment (per sheet)
items.description: A thin sheet of animal skin used for writing. More durable than paper, favored for scrolls【302:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Perfume (per vial)
items.description: A small glass vial of fragrant liquid. Worn or used ceremonially to mask odors or show wealth.

items.name: Piton
items.description: A metal spike driven into rock surfaces with a hammer. Used to secure ropes during climbing or rappelling【308:0†items.json】.

items.name: Quiver
items.description: A container made of leather or wood used to carry arrows, typically slung over the back or belt【314:6†items.json】.

items.name: Rope (per 50 ft.), Hemp
items.description: A coarse and durable rope used for climbing, securing, or hauling. Supports up to 500 lbs.【314:6†items.json】.

items.name: Rope (per 50 ft.), Silk
items.description: A lightweight but incredibly strong rope. Supports up to 400 lbs. and is preferred for climbing or stealthy operations【320:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Sack, Large
items.description: A large burlap or cloth sack used to carry up to 40 pounds of goods. Has a drawstring closure.

items.name: Sack, Small
items.description: A small sack suitable for 20 pounds of items. Convenient for storing tools, rations, or coins.

items.name: Sealing/candle wax (per lb.)
items.description: A pound of wax used for sealing letters, documents, or containers. Can also serve as candle material.

items.name: Sewing needle
items.description: A small metal needle used to mend clothing or gear. Essential for field repairs and tailoring【320:3†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Signet ring or personal seal
items.description: A ring or stamp bearing a personal or noble insignia. Used to authenticate documents or seal letters.

items.name: Soap (per lb.)
items.description: A bar or lump of soap used for bathing, laundry, or cleaning equipment. Commonly made from fat and lye【326:1†TSR 2159 - Player's Handbook.pdf】.

items.name: Spyglass
items.description: A long, telescoping lens device that magnifies distant objects. Rare and expensive, often used at sea.

items.name: Tent, Large
items.description: Shelters 6-10 people. Constructed from canvas and poles, offering protection from weather. Bulky but essential for large groups【332:2†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Tent, Pavilion
items.description: A luxurious or command-style tent for nobles or military officers. Spacious, often adorned, and requires multiple people to erect【332:2†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Tent, Small
items.description: A compact canvas tent for 1–2 people. Lightweight and easy to set up, ideal for adventurers or scouts【332:2†TSR 2121 - Tome of Magic.pdf】.

items.name: Thieves' picks
items.description: A set of small metal tools used by thieves to open locks, disable traps, or manipulate small devices.

items.name: Water clock
items.description: A timekeeping device using water to measure intervals. Complex and uncommon, usually found in noble homes or temples.

items.name: Wineskin
items.description: A flexible leather flask used to carry water, wine, or ale. Sealed with a cork or stopper.

items.name: Winter blanket
items.description: A thick wool or fur blanket used for warmth during cold nights or winter travel.

items.name: Writing ink (per vial)
items.description: A vial of dark ink used for writing with quills or pens. Essential for scrolls, letters, and spellbooks.
